author: Staff Reporter
text:
Police are on the lookout for a 35-year-old man who allegedly murdered his brother at Thally near here on Sunday night. They were the sons of the panchayat president of Kothauppanur in Gurubarapalli.

The accused, Edhubhushan Reddy (35), had an argument over property with his brother Purushottaman Reddy (38) at their farm on Sunday night.

They reportedly got into a duel and the accused had hit Purushottaman with an iron rod, killing him instantly.

Purushottaman Reddy, a real estate dealer, was arrested in 2012 for the murder of Periyar Dravida Kazhagam’s district convenor Palanichamy and has also been detained under the Goondas Act.

The brothers were also linked to the murder of Bhaskar, a Naxal sympathiser, in Thally.

When contacted, the Superintendent of Police R.Thirunavukkarasu said that the accused was at large.
title: Search on for man accused of fratricide
